Text: The world is watching to see how the US and our allies respond to Putin‚Äôs continued aggression against Ukraine. With @POTUS‚Äô swift action to impose a first round of sanctions against the Russian regime, we are sending a clear message ‚Äì You cannot attack a democracy with impunity. https://t.co/2shmmnhlb9

Putin‚Äôs invasion of Ukrainian territory is a gross violation of its sovereignty and the rights of its people. I support @POTUS‚Äô decision to impose immediate costs on the Russian regime thru sanctions and prepare to ratchet up this pressure if Putin continues to reject diplomacy. https://t.co/Sl7fMc7wfb
Today, as we celebrate #PresidentsDay, I‚Äôm grateful there is now someone in the Oval Office who is committed to ensuring that we have a nation where truth, equality, and justice prevail.

Back from Munich Conference w/ bipartisan, bicameral delegation demonstrating strong unity of purpose in the face of Putin‚Äôs threats. NATO is firmly united behind @POTUS‚Äô strategy of diplomacy & deterrence ‚Äî and will impose sure, swift & severe sanctions if Putin invades Ukraine.
Best of luck to the @BowieState Bulldogs as they prepare to host the 2022 #CIAATourney in Baltimore this week!

Under current law, any Marylander can buy gun parts online and assemble them at home to make a working gun with minimal effort. But unlike guns from a gun shop, without a serial number on these parts, ‚Äúghost guns‚Äù are undetectable and untraceable. It is urgent that we fix that.

I was honored to join Marylanders for the 41st Annual Black History Month Breakfast along with @LeaderHoyer @RepAnthonyBrown & @RepUnderwood. 

During this time of COVID-19, we focused on the contributions Black Americans have made to science and vaccine development. https://t.co/9J0YywCKeM

I‚Äôm glad we were able to come together to prevent a shameful government shutdown and ensure critical services remain open to the American people. Our priority now must be passing funding legislation to meet our nation‚Äôs changing needs.

Throughout the pandemic, we‚Äôve heard from thousands of MDers struggling to get unemployment benefits from the MD Dept of Labor. The American Rescue Plan has a new program to improve state UI services, and we‚Äôre urging MD to apply. https://t.co/z6VgJ3bqeD

Too often, companies rely on forced arbitration & non-disclosure agreements to hide sexual harassment and assault & silence survivors. Enough is enough. I‚Äôm proud to have voted to #EndForcedArbitration. Now, it‚Äôs heading to @POTUS‚Äô desk to be signed into law.

Passing #FMLA was an important achievement but there's still a long way to go in the fight for #PaidLeaveForAll. No one should have to choose between their health, their family & their paycheck. 28 years later‚Äìworkers deserve more. It's time to expand paid leave for all Americans

365 days ago @POTUS was sworn in as our Capitol was still on lockdown & our nation in shock

A historic recovery is now underway. There's more work to do ‚Äì but we've come a long, long way

No Marylander should have to worry about access to clean water.

We will not stop fighting until we guarantee equal access to the ballot box for every American. Tonight every Democrat was in support of that legislation and every Republican opposed. I am disappointed that the undemocratic filibuster thwarted the effort, but we will not give up. https://t.co/v6m6Y0qLYq

Since 1974 there's been 1 major exception to filibuster's 60-vote rule: the Reconciliation Process. And it exposes this absurdity. It allowed for passage of Trump's Tax Law, American Rescue Plan, & Affordable Care Act. But it won't allow us to pass bills to protect our democracy! https://t.co/bgjXpBLiL0

How it looks in the context of the #FreedomtoVoteAct?  

IN FAVOR: A duly elected President who won over 80 million votes; a majority of House of Reps, & 50 Senators representing 62% of the American people 

OPPOSED: a minority of Senators representing a minority of the country.

So where did the current Senate Rule come from? It is a total invention of Senators that empowers a minority of Senators by disempowering the overwhelming majority of the American people. That‚Äôs what it is.

Time & again the Jan 6th Cmtee mission to get to the bottom of the assault on our Capitol has been upheld by our courts. This decision underscores just that. Our democracy is at stake & false claims of exec privilege cannot get in the way of delivering the American ppl the truth. https://t.co/85nLBfTVZw

Under our current rules, 41 Senators representing 11% of the American people can block the vote of 50 senators representing 80% of the country. Think about that‚Ä¶ and they don‚Äôt even have to show up to do it. How crazy is that?

What about the power of the minority, you ask? We already protect the power of the minority inherently in the Senate by electing 2 Senators from each state ‚Äì despite their population. Wyoming (pop. 578,000) and California (pop. 39 M) both have equal influence in the U.S. Senate. https://t.co/NGhmPsZeJm

Don‚Äôt be fooled: the filibuster is NOWHERE to be found in our Constitution. But you know what is? Clear rules for when a 2/3 vote is required. The Founders specified those cases where a supermajority vote is required. It doesn't apply to passing bills like the #FreedomToVoteAct. https://t.co/wEeuZEqeVR

Let‚Äôs talk abt the hypocrisy of the GOP bringing up what the ‚ÄúFounders intended.‚Äù The Founders never intended for 41 Senators ‚Äì a minority ‚Äì to have power to block the will of 59 Senators ‚Äì the majority ‚Äì on legislation. We‚Äôve got it in writing from Madison & Hamilton themselves. https://t.co/nhspsMUSTi

Sen. McConnell just cited James Madison to defend the rule allowing 41 of 100 senators to stop a majority from voting on the #FreedomtoVoteAct. He should read these words by Madison in Federalist 58, opposing such provisions: https://t.co/OayTlrAsZN

The claim that the filibuster rule promotes bipartisanship flies in the face of the reality we witness every day. In fact, the filibuster has become a partisan political weapon & each day we maintain this undemocratic rule we prevent our democracy from working as it was intended. https://t.co/rVE8dTAcvp

All of us prefer to find common ground to meet our challenges when we can. But let's not kid ourselves about the ability of the 60 vote filibuster requirement to promote bipartisanship. The rule is now used for obstruction not cooperation. https://t.co/oxIj9iOMhP

Since the attack on our Capitol the Big Lie has not died, instead, it has metastasized. To protect our democracy, we must step up & pass votings rts legislation & to do that we‚Äôve got to amend the #filibuster. I‚Äôm speaking NOW on this urgent call to action https://t.co/zKmdAOcn6k

Thankful that the congregants of Beth Israel Synagogue in Colleyville, TX are safe. As we see a rise in hate crimes across this country targeting communities with increased violence, we must call out and combat antisemitism and hate in all its ugly forms.

As we face a range of economic challenges ‚Äî from COVID-19, to the need to create more shared prosperity, to climate change ‚Äî we need strong leadership at the Fed. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm glad to see @POTUS nominate Sarah Bloom Raskin, Lisa Cook, and Philip Jefferson.

As @POTUS laid out: our democracy faces a turning point, & the next few days are critical. 

We‚Äôve got to stand up for the right to vote.

We can‚Äôt let the filibuster stop us. 

We must pass the #FreedomToVote & #JohnLewisVotingRightsAct.

I urge my colleagues to heed this call.

Our democracy hangs in the balance. It‚Äôs time for the Senate to bring up the #FreedomToVoteAct and the #JohnLewisVotingRightsAct. We must do whatever it takes to stop the GOP obstruction of these bills and protect Americans‚Äô right to vote.
